result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond R Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

Probation may be transferred to the State of Georgia. Defendant NOT to travel outside the State of Georgia without agent's permission. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained, surcharge is imposed. No Contact with any co-defendants or any victims listed in the criminal complaint. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Not to use or possess any checking related documents or bank checks unless received from HIS employer to him. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 100 days were granted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

from Defendant's father

Defendant Desmond R Harris in court, in custody, with Attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Special Agent Theresa Williams makes statements.  Assistant Chief Hennen makes statements.  State makes statements/recommendations regarding sentencing.  Attorney Martinez makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:   IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

5  YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  3 YEARS            **transfer allowed to State of Georgia** 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Submit to Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed.
____Not to use or possess any checking related documents/bank checks (unless received from HIS employer to him) 
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: any Co-Defendant's or any victims listed in criminal complaint
____Not to travel outside of the State of Georgia without agent's permission 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

CONDITION TIME:   6 Months straight time- (100 days credit) to commence forthwith 

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
